item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, March 14, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Samsung bricked their home theater systems through automated firmware update (298 points | 230 comments)
2. The 2FA app that tells you when you get `314159` (2024) (91 points | 28 comments)
3. I'm Peter Roberts, immigration attorney who does work for YC and startups. AMA (101 points | 131 comments)

7. I-cant-believe-its-not-webusb: Hacking around lack of WebUSB support in Firefox (241 points | 184 comments)
8. Apparently magpies and crows are using “anti-bird spikes” to make nests (2023) (158 points | 52 comments)
9. Prequel (YC W21) Is Hiring a Strong Front End Engineer ( | hide)

11. Any insider takes on Yann LeCun's push against current architectures? (29 points | 10 comments)

13. My Scammer Girlfriend: Baiting a Romance Fraudster (307 points | 104 comments)

18. Y Combinator urges the White House to support Europe's Digital Markets Act (420 points | 308 comments)

20. OpenAI asks White House for relief from state AI rules (719 points | 652 comments)
21. The Lost Art of Logarithms (504 points | 180 comments)
22. “Normal” engineers are the key to great teams (527 points | 460 comments)
23. The School Car Pickup Line Is a National Embarrassment (126 points | 158 comments)
24. (Any) 8-hour time-restricted-eating window effective for weight loss (14 points | 2 comments)
25. Liu Jiakun Receives the 2025 Pritzker Architecture Prize (34 points | 35 comments)
26. How ProPublica Uses AI in Its Investigations (38 points | 7 comments)
27. Fediverse Donut Club (31 points | 13 comments)
